result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M. Plaza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice Returned - not deliverable as addressed

3:01 p.m. Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is present today and makes statements. State makes sentencing arguments and request a prison sentence. 3:21 p.m.  Atty Halverson makes sentencing statements and request straight jail time served 140 days credit as time served.  Court considers many factors of the this case.
BTC: 180 days jail - 141 days credit --time served
Pay courts, DNA surcharges, & Domestic Abuses Surcharges.
Provide DNA sample.
Count 1
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed by Atty Acalia Halverson
Signed and Unsigned Verdict Form's
#3 Stevens Point Police Department Incident Report Narrative dated 03/24/15
#2 Certified copy of Judgment of Conviction for 15CM132
#1 Certified copy of Judgment of Conviction for 15CM2

Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in court with Attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Jonathan M. Plaza in custody. Attorney David Knaapen appears for the state, along with Officer Kristi Ahrens. 

***************Morning Clerk is JB***************
8:27 am Motions in Limine were addressed in chambers prior to court.

8:43 am Court welcomes jurors and introduces the parties.
8:47 am Clerk administers Voir Dire Oath. Clerk calls 23 jurors to be seated.
8:52 am Court administers Voir Dire.
8:59 am Individual Voir Dire in chambers with Juror #1514. 
9:09 am Juror #1514 excused and replaced with Juror #1577.  
Court continues Voir Dire.
9:16 am Atty Knaapen administers Voir Dire.
9:39 am Atty Halverson administers Voir Dire.
9:57 am Parties exercise their peremptory strikes.
The following 13 jurors have been chosen:
Juror #1500, 1541, 1546, 1547, 1552, 1563, 1588, 1594, 1610, 1636, 1639, 1643, and 1657.
10:17 am Court thanks the jurors who have not been chosen and excuses them.
10:18 am Clerk administers Jurors Oath.
Court gives opening instructions to the jurors.
10:22 am Court is in recess for 20 minutes.

10:44 am Court is back in session.
10:48 am Jurors are escorted into the courtroom.
10:49 am Court gives preliminary instructions to the jurors.
10:59 am Atty Knaapen makes opening statements.
11:07 am Atty Halverson makes opening statements.

11:13 am M. Plaza is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness identifies defendant.
Exhibits #1-3 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff, and referred to during testimony.
11:38 am Cross examination by Atty Halverson.
11:50 am Re-direct examination by Atty Knaapen. 
11:54 am Re-cross examination by Atty Halverson.
11:58 am Witness is excused from his subpoena.

11:59 am Court excuses jurors for lunch. Court to resume after 1:00 pm bond hearing.

***************Afternoon Clerk is EP***************

1:25 p.m. Back on the record, outside of the present of the jurors. Parties do not put anything on the record.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.

ADA calls the witness and clerk swears in the witness.  ADA examines the (J.Klein, police officer).  Refers to Exhibit #1 in examination.  
1:27 p.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Halverson.  
Witness is released from subpoena.
1:29 p.m.  Clerk swears in the witness.  Judge questions the jurors whether any juror knows the witness.  ADA indicates it was an over sight of not providing the witness' name to the Court.  Judge conducts a voir dire of the juror.  
ADA questions the juror.  Attorney Halverson does not voir dire the juror.
ADA examines the witness, (Officer Anderson).  
1:34 p.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Halverson.  
Witness is excused from his subpoena.
 !:35 p.m.  Clerk swears in the witness, (Officer K. Ahrens).  ADA examines the witness.  Witness identifies the defendant.  
1:41 p.m.  Cross examination by defense.  
1:47 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Knaapen.  
1:48 p.m.  Recross by Attorney Halverson.  
1:51 p.m.  Witness is released from the subpoena.
Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court allows the defense attorney to discuss with defendant.  

1:55 p.m.  Court is back on the record without the jurors present.  
Court questions the defendant and his attorney.  Court finds the defendant is freely and voluntarily exercising his right not to testify.

Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  The evidentarily portion of the trial is over.  
Court gives the jurors further instructions of the matter.  
2:01 p.m.  Clerk draws the alternate juror and  the juror is excused. 
2:02 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom while the court works on the jury instructions.  
2:27 p.m.  This is jury instructions conference without the jurors present in the courtroom.  Attorney Halverson makes record as to jury instruction.  ADA responds.  Court uses the standard Jury Instruction and does not make changes as requested by Attorney Halverson.  
The final modifications have been made to the Jury Instructions. 
3:01 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  Court gives instructions to the jury.  
3:19 p.m.  ADA makes his closing statement to the jurors.  
3:28 p.m.  Attorney Halverson gives closing statement to the jurors.
3:35 p.m.  Rebuttal closing by ADA Knaapen.
3:43 p.m.  Court gives final instructions to jurors
3:46 p.m.  Clerk administers Oath to Officers..  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court clarifies the jury instruction read to the jurors.  Defendant is to remain in the courthouse until the court indicate.  

4:01 p.m.  Court is back on the record.  
4:03 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back in to the courtroom.
Court reads the signed verdict.  

16CF24 - Guilty.
Court polls the jurors individually.  

The question portion of the verdict-answer:  Yes. Court polled each jurors individually.

Court informs the jurors their service is complete, informs them they can talk about the case now but are not required to and thanks the jurors for their service.  
4:06 p.m. Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.

ADA Knaapen motions the court.

BTC:
Based on unaimous conviction of the jury, the court finds the defendant guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater 

No request for pre-sentence by either party.

Sentencing hearing (30 min.) is set for May 12, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Attorney Halverson makes a statement re: inpatient treatment program for defendant

Court will take up the inpatient treatment if in fact this occurs.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.

4:13 p.m. case is concluded.
Filed by Atty Acalia Halverson

Court questions Atty Knaapen.
Atty Halverson makes arguments to the Court.
Court questions Atty Halverson.
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments.

Court questions Atty Knaapen and Atty Halverson for clarification on facts and circumstances.

BY THE COURT:
Court admits the incidents the State is seeking.
Court states this issue will be addressed during the trial, if it should arise.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.
